column13: This year, BlueScope continued to build its HSE capacity through the development of its people. This process started in FY2021 with BlueScope's leadership group participating in expert-led workshops and is now extending across BlueScope's workforce. Over 1,500 people participated in business-led HSE learning programs and activities in FY2023, as BlueScope's lead metric shifted from Leaders to incorporate broader workforce participation and learning.

column13: NS BlueScope Thailand and Asia Steel Transport have partnered to develop steel coil transport safety initiatives. Together, team members engaged truck drivers in meetings to learn about the reality of work and how to control risk effectively. The drivers were asked what support they needed to work more safely. Through the partnership, around 100 fleet drivers were trained in defensive driving, improvement in auditing and equipment checks.

column13: Tata BlueScope Steel ran a series of community support events through its Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) initiative, which seeks to make a difference in people's lives.
